title: Job’s Final Declaration of Innocence
summary: Job lists ways he has lived righteously—avoiding lust, dishonesty, injustice, and greed. He says if he’s guilty of any such sins, he deserves punishment. This is his final defense before demanding an answer from God.

faq.question: What kind of life does Job describe living?
faq.answer: A life of moral integrity, generosity, and reverence for God.

faq.question: Why is this chapter important?
faq.answer: It is Job’s final appeal for justice—a personal oath of innocence before God.
